meanings.definition: To lecture or speak publicly on a subject before an audience.
meanings.sent1: The professor enjoys prelecting about history to his students.
meanings.sent2: She will be prelecting on the importance of recycling at the conference.
meanings.sent3: The comedian prelecting about the quirks of daily life had the audience in stitches.
meanings.sent4: The politician was prelecting his promises to the crowd, hoping to win their votes.
meanings.sent5: The expert prelecting on astronomy made the complex topic easy to understand for everyone.

meanings.definition: The act of delivering a lecture or speech before an audience.
meanings.sent1: Attending prelecting sessions helps students improve their public speaking skills.
meanings.sent2: The prelecting at the seminar was informative and engaging.
meanings.sent3: The prelecting at the town hall meeting was unexpectedly entertaining.
meanings.sent4: The prelecting of the renowned scientist captivated the entire audience.
meanings.sent5: The prelecting on climate change left a lasting impact on the listeners.
